dict.string: Force at which speed reaches zero (must be > 0)
Speed of the motor when its load is zero. A positive value specifies a plus-end directed motor. A negative value specifies a minus-end directed motor.

If true, the speed is limited to the range [0, 2*unloaded_speed]. With ( limit_speed = 1 ), a plus-end directed motor will never move towards the minus-end, and will not exceed 2x its unloaded speed. For a minus-end directed motor, the permitted range is [2*unloaded_speed, 0], thus also excluding backward steps and excessive speed.
